FuncDef:
The ipv6-pool warning-threshold command sets an alarm threshold for the address usage of the IPv6 address pools bound to a VPN instance so that the device generates an alarm when the IPv6 address usage reaches the threshold.
The undo ipv6-pool warning-threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold for the address usage of an IPv6 address pool is 80%.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold for the IPv6 address usage, in percentage. For example, the value 80 indicates that the device generates an alarm when the address usage of the IPv6 address pool reaches 80%.The value 0 indicates that the alarm function is disabled.
The value is an integer ranges from 0 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an alarm threshold for the address usage of the IPv6 address pools bound to a VPN instance, run the ipv6-pool warning-threshold command so that the device generates an alarm when the IPv6 address usage reaches the threshold. This prompts the administrator to plan addresses to prevent user login failures due to address exhaustion.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
